intro: Glaucium luteum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth yellow hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow, rayless flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are glabrous, or smooth to the touch. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Papaveraceae family.
